title: Velvét Bags Best Sustainable Design Title

content.text: At the prestigious Eco-Fashion Summit 2025, Velvét has clinched the coveted Best Sustainable Design award, marking a major milestone in the brand’s ongoing commitment to eco-conscious luxury. Recognized for its innovative use of sustainable materials, Velvét continues to lead the charge in ethical fashion, reshaping the industry for a greener future.

Founder Ritvik Sharma has always placed sustainability at the heart of Velvét’s vision. 'We don’t just make luxury; we create luxury that respects the earth,' he explains. From using organic fabrics like bamboo silk and hemp to experimenting with low-impact dyes that reduce environmental pollution, Velvét is setting new standards for what it means to be a responsible luxury brand.

Velvét's commitment to sustainability is not just about using eco-friendly materials but also ensuring fair trade practices with over 30 ethical mills worldwide. Each piece, from tailored suits to evening gowns, embodies the brand’s mission to merge craftsmanship with environmental stewardship.

'We believe sustainability is the new luxury,' says Sharma. 'It’s not a trend but a responsibility, and it’s time the industry started aligning itself with the values that will protect our planet for future generations.'

Velvét’s design ethos is deeply rooted in responsible luxury. Every collection is the result of meticulous planning, where sustainability isn't an afterthought but the foundation of each creation. Whether it's designing garments to be biodegradable or using recycled fibers, Sharma and his team are committed to creating pieces that make a difference — without compromising on quality or aesthetic.
With increasing consumer demand for ethical and sustainable options, Velvét has embraced this challenge, demonstrating that luxury and environmental consciousness can go hand in hand.
The Future of Fashion is Green

Looking ahead, Velvét plans to expand its sustainability initiatives further. The brand is exploring innovations in eco-friendly packaging, extending its use of plant-based and recycled materials, and continuing to partner with organizations that promote sustainable farming practices.
As Velvét sets its sights on the future, Sharma’s vision remains clear: 'Sustainability isn’t just a goal; it’s our future. We're not here to follow trends — we're here to create them.'
